ATIA.content: naked words, words from the heart, starting from Genesis
ATIA.linkedContent: naked words, words from the heart, starting from Genesis

ATIA.content: nudity as the proper of man, animals naked w/out knowing they are
ATIA.linkedContent: nudity as the proper of man, animals naked w/out knowing they are

ATIA.content: there is no nudity in “nature,” only the affect, sentiment, experience of existing in nakedness > animal not naked because naked
ATIA.linkedContent: there is no nudity in “nature,” only the affect, sentiment, experience of existing in nakedness > animal not naked because naked

ATIA.content: contretemps of 2 nudities w/out nudity: 1) animal in non-nudity because nude 2) man in nudity so no longer nude
ATIA.linkedContent: contretemps of 2 nudities w/out nudity: 1) animal in non-nudity because nude 2) man in nudity so no longer nude

ATIA.content: if “dressing oneself,” clothing, is proper to man, it arrives w/ all the others: speech, reason, logos, history, laughing, mourning, burial, gift, the concept of the concept
ATIA.linkedContent: if “dressing oneself,” clothing, is proper to man, it arrives w/ all the others: speech, reason, logos, history, laughing, mourning, burial, gift, the concept of the concept

ATIA.content: nudity as passivity, involuntary exhibition in face-to-face: the passion of the animal, my passion of the animal (other)
ATIA.linkedContent: nudity as passivity, involuntary exhibition in face-to-face: the passion of the animal, my passion of the animal (other)

ATIA.content: to think the war we find ourselves waging [against animals] is not only a duty, no one can escape it: thinking, perhaps, begins when animal looks at us and we are naked before it
ATIA.linkedContent: to think the war we find ourselves waging [against animals] is not only a duty, no one can escape it: thinking, perhaps, begins when animal looks at us and we are naked before it

ATIA.content: “the animot is more naked than the human, who is more naked than the animot” > this law governing nudity never resists placing woman/child on side of animal
ATIA.linkedContent: “the animot is more naked than the human, who is more naked than the animot” > this law governing nudity never resists placing woman/child on side of animal

ATIA.content: wouldn’t hetero-narcissism of sexual coupling give animals the right to modesty/shame, sensitivity to nakedness?
ATIA.linkedContent: wouldn’t hetero-narcissism of sexual coupling give animals the right to modesty/shame, sensitivity to nakedness?

ATIA.content: there is a certain jouissance (anguish) when an animal looks at Derrida naked ——Derrida would prefer not to appear naked before an animal
ATIA.linkedContent: there is a certain jouissance (anguish) when an animal looks at Derrida naked ——Derrida would prefer not to appear naked before an animal

ATIA.content: for Descartes, human is different from animal because he can think extension, the intelligible body (of wax), the naked wax that can’t be touched, animal only senses the sensible nonnaked wax > man can undress the wax [have you ever tried to do that?]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Descartes, human is different from animal because he can think extension, the intelligible body (of wax), the naked wax that can’t be touched, animal only senses the sensible nonnaked wax > man can undress the wax [have you ever tried to do that?]

ATIA.content: Levinas’ nudity doesn’t concern itself w/ sexual difference, w/ animal
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas’ nudity doesn’t concern itself w/ sexual difference, w/ animal

REST.content: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest
REST.linkedContent: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest

REST.content: if clothing for Kant is parergonal, and if what is proper to representation is the “nude,” what do we make of these “old shoes w/ laces”? > a “pure” supplement? parergon w/out ergon?
REST.linkedContent: if clothing for Kant is parergonal, and if what is proper to representation is the “nude,” what do we make of these “old shoes w/ laces”? > a “pure” supplement? parergon w/out ergon?

AD.content: for Pascal, strip “I” of everything attributed to it, make it naked, bare; for Levinas, nudity is infinitely exposed vulnerability—skin
AD.linkedContent: for Pascal, strip “I” of everything attributed to it, make it naked, bare; for Levinas, nudity is infinitely exposed vulnerability—skin

FV.content: Stoff (incest w/ mother, murder of father), all else (i.e. tragic destiny) is secondary > the analytic deciphering: denuding (mise à nu) of this Stoff beneath secondary disguises: naked truth, truth as nakedness, meaning behind the formal disguises
FV.linkedContent: Stoff (incest w/ mother, murder of father), all else (i.e. tragic destiny) is secondary > the analytic deciphering: denuding (mise à nu) of this Stoff beneath secondary disguises: naked truth, truth as nakedness, meaning behind the formal disguises

FV.content: exhibiting, undressing (déshabillage), unveiling (dévoilement): acrobatics of metaphor of truth, metaphor of metaphor, truth of truth > when Freud intends to denude original Stoff: text coordinated à sa vérité nue, mais aussi à la vérité comme nudité
FV.linkedContent: exhibiting, undressing (déshabillage), unveiling (dévoilement): acrobatics of metaphor of truth, metaphor of metaphor, truth of truth > when Freud intends to denude original Stoff: text coordinated à sa vérité nue, mais aussi à la vérité comme nudité

FV.content: Schreber: we all (women included) like naked women
FV.linkedContent: Schreber: we all (women included) like naked women

FV.content: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber]
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber]

FV.content: for Freud, dream recasts [Stoff] in Einkleidung (garment, disguising, falsifying), the emperor is the dreamer, the imposter is the dream
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dream recasts [Stoff] in Einkleidung (garment, disguising, falsifying), the emperor is the dreamer, the imposter is the dream

FV.content: Freud pays no attention to a fold in the text [Emperor’s…], literary narrative is a secondary elaboration, thus an Einkleidung > since Andersens’ text has the text as its theme, it puts Freud’s text [interpretation] onstage
FV.linkedContent: Freud pays no attention to a fold in the text [Emperor’s…], literary narrative is a secondary elaboration, thus an Einkleidung > since Andersens’ text has the text as its theme, it puts Freud’s text [interpretation] onstage

FV.content: if dream of nakedness is a dream of shame, nakedness is not natural: its truth is in shame
FV.linkedContent: if dream of nakedness is a dream of shame, nakedness is not natural: its truth is in shame

FV.content: hidden theme of Emperor’s… is the hidden theme, text as its theme, text as veil, movement of alētheia
FV.linkedContent: hidden theme of Emperor’s… is the hidden theme, text as its theme, text as veil, movement of alētheia
